summary: Frontend testing of CapCut-style video editor bug fixes - All 10 requested features verified and working. Tested: drag-drop videos/images to timeline, timeline 1-hour duration (3600s minimum in code), minor tick marks between major markers, Inspector panel with all property sliders, and transformation controls.

critical_code_review_comments: Drag-drop implementation uses proper HTML5 API with dataTransfer.setData('mediaId', id) and stopPropagation()
Timeline minimum duration is 3600 seconds (1 hour) as specified in getTimelineWidth() function
TimeRuler has dynamic tick intervals based on zoom level (majorInterval and minorInterval)
Minor ticks rendered with h-1.5 height and opacity-40 for visual distinction from major ticks
InspectorPanel properly updates clip properties via UPDATE_CLIP_PROPS dispatch action
PreviewPanel applies all transformations: opacity, scale, rotation, position, flip, brightness, contrast, saturation, hue, blendMode
context_for_next_testing_agent: All bug fixes verified working: 1) Drag-drop uses HTML5 API with dataTransfer - drag from media tiles with [data-media-id] to tracks with [data-track-type], 2) Timeline has 3600s (1 hour) minimum duration in getTimelineWidth(), 3) TimeRuler renders minor ticks between major ticks with dynamic intervals based on zoom level. Key selectors: [data-testid='add-demo-video'], [data-testid='add-demo-image'], [data-track-type='video'], .bg-gradient-to-r for clips. Inspector shows all properties when clip is selected.
